readingMnemonic: It's great having a <kanji>floor</kanji> or <kanji>bed</kanji>, but whenever you use it you say <reading>yucka</reading> (ゆか) because it just gets so dirty. That's the one flaw of using a floor as a bed. In fact, it's the dirtiest floor you've ever seen, because it's covered in <reading>yucca</reading> (ゆか) leaves. You're sleeping on a yucca floor. Ew!
meaningMnemonic: Under the <radical>canopy</radical>, you use a <radical>tree</radical> for your <kanji>floor</kanji>. It also becomes your <kanji>bed</kanji>, because hey, what is a floor but the original bed?
